properties.areaDesc: Chesapeake Bay from Drum Point MD to Smith Point VA; Tidal Potomac from Cobb Island MD to Smith Point VA; Tangier Sound and the inland waters surrounding Bloodsworth Island
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 4 at 10:18PM EST by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
properties.description:
A few southwesterly wind gusts to around 20 knots are possible
through late this evening, particularly over the lower tidal
Potomac River southeast of Cobb Point Maryland, and the Maryland
portion of the Chesapeake Bay between Drum Point Maryland and
Smith Point Virginia, including the Tangier Sound and the inland
waters surrounding Bloodsworth Island. Mariners, especially those
in smaller vessels, should exercise extra caution if navigating
the waters during this time.

Winds will switch to northerly after a cold front crosses the area
around 3 or 4 AM and gust to around 20 knots more frequently
through late Wednesday morning. A Small Craft Advisory is in
effect for that time.

NWSheadline: OCCASIONAL WIND GUSTS TO AROUND 20 KNOTS
